author: costin
msg: JspServlet goes to runtime.
Few comments.

author: costin
msg: - removed the JspServlet handling
- refactored the requestMap ( made the checks a bit cleaner and simpler,
split the preCompile check in a separate method - it was growing too bit )
- refactored jikes autodetection ( it had one case where it failed - if
the first used JSP had an error ). Now it's very nice and clean - the
first time we compile a test file.
- refactored the translation, for better messages ( and to support line
mapping of compiler errors to JSP file line numbers ).
Now "file not found" errors and compilation errors will just display the
message, without the ugly stack trace ( which didn't tell anything - just
the location of javac and jsp2java calls ).

author: costin
msg: Split JspInterceptor's handling of JspServlet.
There are 4 distinct methods of plugging jasper:
- JspInterceptor - use a lot of container internals
- JspServlet, requiring minimal container support ( all in JspServletInteceptor
for tomcat33 )
- JspServlet in the webapp ( with settings in web.xml ) - no support from
the container needed ( except the attributes )
- the 4-th is still on the design stage, but I think it'll be very cool.
Details later.

author: costin
msg: Added the JspServletLiaison implementation ( the code is the old JspServlet
code - still need cleanup )

author: costin
msg: Moved JspServletWrapper from o.a.j34.servlet
